alert.note: Alert for Northwest Pocahontas; Southeast Randolph (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 07 at 3:38AM EST until January 08 at 6:00AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM EST THIS MORNING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch with storm totals between 10 to 14 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 15 below zero. * WHERE...Northwest Pocahontas and Southeast Randolph Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 8 AM EST this morning. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 6 AM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Very difficult to impossible travel conditions. Slick roads and road closures occurring. Hazardous conditions will impact commutes through the morning. The cold wind chills could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: Avoid travel. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Use caution while outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Additional information can be found at https://www.weather.gov/rlx as well as on our Facebook and Twitter pages.
